page.title: 19Marchwood Park House
page.content: {Marchwood Park is a magnificent house} standing high up surrounded by a green park of 187 acres.It was built in 1826 on a hill because the owner,being an old naval man, liked to watch the ships sailing up and down Southampton Water.He was also responsible for building the parish church and the first school in Marchwood. Until 1935 it was occupied by several owners.After the 2nd World War it became a home for airman who were recovering from burns received while flying bombers and fighters.For a few years it was used as a language school.It has now been bought by a large American company who plan to use it as a private hospital.It is hoped that this will provide extra jobs for people in the Marchwood area.
